name: Dove Creek Lodge

reviews.text: I loved this hotel! From the minute we walked in our room we thought it was perfect. Clean, spacious, modern and beautifully decorated. My favorite part was the balcony with a fantastic view to the ocean. Each unit looks out onto the Atlantic but some look they are blocked a little by trees growing in the garden. The private pool and sandy pier area adjoining the private docking area are wonderful too. Good price too. Snappers restaurant is right next door, which is excellent, but do expect some nightlife noise, but it really wasn't bad at all. They have fantastic Key Lime Pie! Key Largo in general was fantastic, I would definetly return. It was quiet (no spring breakers!), had the best restaurants I went to in the Keys and many opportunities to snorkel, fish, and any water sport you can imagine. I would highly recommend sunsets at Marker 88 restaurant - great food and fantastic location, our table was five feet from the Gulf! Tower of Pizza for lunch is fun. Bahia Honda State Park was wonderful. I can see why it made the list of best beaches in the USA. Just know what to excect of beaches in the Keys - it isn't Panama City with long wide stretches of sand and strong waves. The coral reef breaks the waves and catches much of the sediment, so there are few beaches and what there are are short and not very wide, yet the water, sky and vegetation is incredibly beautiful. There was quite a bit of seagrass in the water at Bahia Honda so swimming wouldn't have been great that day, but reading and walking on the beach was just as worth it. Don't listen to people's negative reviews of the Keys - just do your research and have the right expectations!
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great place! We stopped at Snapper's for lunch and saw the Lodge and walked over to check it out. We were so impressed we booked a room and checked out of the hotel we were staying in for double the money. The staff was awesome and so was our room. I would highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for an clean, affordable room in the Florida Keys.
reviews.title: Best Kept Secret in the Keys

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted to find a place to stay that wasn't as expensive as the name brand resorts, but still nice. I ran across Dove Creek on TripAdvisor and I found it hard to believe it had such a positive rating. Nevertheless it seemed decent so we booked and we were very happy with Dove Creek. The staff was very pleasant and the facility was quite clean and quiet. The bed was quite comforable and we slept great. The only downsides we noticed were the hot water was tepid during the first few days of our trip, but so was the air temperature (in the 50's and 60's). When the weather warmed into the upper 60's and 70's the water was hot again. I was about to say something to the staff when it fixed itself (or perhaps they were on it already). We stayed in one of the rooms adjoining the lobby and the hallway door to the outside slams - but fortunately they lock that at 9pm! It did tend to wake us in the mornings, though. Only four of the rooms have these doors. It's nitpicking really, most of the time the facility as a whole was quite calm and peaceful and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came down for Valentines weekend to escape the cold. The staff was the best!! The room was AMAZING!!! Very quiet and relaxing. My favorite part was getting in the hot tub each night with a glass of wine and listen o the music around the pool with the tiki torches lit everynight. It is a great place to have a short romantic get away with your other half. What a great place!!!
reviews.title: Snow Day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night.
reviews.title: Very nice place.
perfect
reviews.text: cant say one bad thing about this place,,clean,,quiet,,and perfect amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Exceptional value in Key Largo. Room was spacious, clean and bed was very comfortable. View was outstanding. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wow! Great find in Key Largo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From our arrival to our departure, Dove Creek exceeded our expectations. The ocean view from our balcony was wonderful, all night long we could hear the waves lapping up on the pier. The room was very comfortable and the staff was helpful. The property includes a section of sand beyond the pool with a hammock and chairs among mangroves. We found this very relaxing. Snapper's, the restaurant associated with Dove Creek had a varied menu with local seafood and the live music was enjoyable, ending before we went to sleep. This is a great value, costing us about half of what we paid in Key West .The only dissapointment was the breakfast, we were offered only bagels and granola. However, we have stayed at a number of hotels in Key Largo, and this is by far the best. We will definitely return to Dove Creek
reviews.title: Our Favorite in Key Largo

reviews.text: Our wedding at Dove Creek Lodge could not have been any better!! From beginning to end, the staff was amazing to work with and very professional. Jamie and Katy are wonderful, attending to every detail making our special day come off seamlessly. We traveled with friends, family and extended family and everyone raved about Dove Creek. The rooms are clean and spacious, the grounds impeccably kept and the staff friendly and attentive. I am so very glad we chose Dove Creek for our wedding; I couldn't be happier with the outcome!! Big thumbs up!!!!
reviews.title: Beautiful wedding venue w/ top notch staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my partner stayed here for 3 days in early January 2010 and had a great time. With accommodation in the Keys in general being expensive we found the Dove Creek Lodge to be the best value for money booking online. When we got there we received a friendly reception, spotless room (with a nice big LCD) a jacuzzi, pool and pool table round the back and a great seafood restaurant literally adjacent to the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, and make sure to take in at least one sunrise in the breakfast area.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Good location, jacuzzi, pool, nice staff & perfect room with lcd

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed during last week of dec and absolutely liked the location. Great view from the patio. Nice bay and they have 2 kayak boats which can be used by customers for free. There was continental breakfast with muffins, apples, coffee....the bed was very comfortable, big bathrooms..overall a very memorable stay...only thing was water was not too hot for shower....
reviews.title: Beautiful location, nice rooms, you can do free kayaking too :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I just celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary with a weeklong trip to Fla. Based on Tripadvisor reviews we cancelled our AAA reservations in Miami & reserved at Dove Creek instead. So happy we did! It was the perfect place to relax & was a good central point for travelling to Key West for the day, deep sea fishing the next, close to Homestead for the Nascar race. The staff were wonderfull & so very helpful. Our room was perfect & clean,only complaint was that the a/c unit was rather noisy every time it came on.Our room had a balcony to enjoy the marina/ocean view - so peaceful to sit out on at night & relax before bed. Snappers, the restaurant next door, was nice, A bit pricey-but we enjoyed dinner & drinks there our first night. We could even sit out on our balcony & enjoy the live music from Snappers. The sunrises were awesome! If I should ever get back down to Key Largo, I would definitely stay at Dove Creek.
reviews.title: So Peaceful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this property on Tripadvisor and we both absolutely loved it. It is immaculately clean and well-managed by the staff of only 4 women and 2 housekeepers(YOU GIRLS ROCK!). It is also a "green" property. We were there during the off-season and had the place to ourselves for 2 nights but nothing went neglected. We enjoyed the restaurant and bar next door. We enjoyed snorkeling the Pennekamp park also. We enjoyed visiting the Islamorada area for restaurants ,especially the Islamorada Fish Company for beautiful sunsets and great smoked fish spread! We actually liked this area of the Keys better than Key West as we vacation more for relaxing and snorkeling than for clubs and shopping. The only thing I would suggest for improvement at Dove Creek would be the breakfast selection but even that was adequate since it was included with the room. The refillable water bottles were a nice touch also. We will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: A BEAUTIFUL PLACE TO RELAX

reviews.text: Recently my husband and i stayed at dove creek lodge with freinds and family, what a retreat. The rooms where wonderfully decorated and clean. The grounds where beautifull and the hotel is Green Certified, awsome. Snappers resturant is next door to the hotel and the food and service were great. The hotel has a a computer in the lobby for printing boarding passes and writing reviews on trip advisor!!!. we will go back.
reviews.title: a slice of heaven!!!!!

reviews.text: Just returned from two nights at the Dove Creek with the main goal of a short scuba diving trip. Our group had four people but the room could comfortably have slept six people. The rooms were some of the most clean I've ever seen. Out back there is a great little pool and jacuzzi that we hung at in the evenings. The location was conveniently located adjacent to Snapper's restaurant and bar which is a fun place to grab a beer and get some good food. We did have some problems with the no-seum bugs biting but if you wanted to avoid them, each room has a screened in porch.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Dove Creek Lodge the weekend of October 22, 2010. We arranged this trip for paddle boarding only and chose the Dove Creek Lodge due to its floating docks and immediate access to the Atlantic. Unfortunately, Hurricane Richard had other ideas for us and kept sending bands of inclement weather our way (small craft advisories, terrible rip currents, etc..). Since hitting the ocean or bay was out for us, we decided to utilize the pool and hot tub onsite. Well, the hot tub never got hot....a matter of fact, not even warm and the pool was a disaster. We notified the front desk of both issues. Granted, it was windy so lots of debris was constantly blowing into the pool but in 2 days, we didn't see one staff member cleaning this very small pool.
reviews.title: Cute Place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a one bedroom, ocean front suite for 2 nights. The room was large and very clean with ample space for the small amount of personal items we brought and two (2) 12’+ paddle boards. The individual screened in porches were a nice touch. Both Friday and Saturday evenings we sat outside in our screened in porch, enjoying an adult beverage listening to the music being performed across the water at Snappers Restaurant.
reviews.title: A GREAT DISCOVERY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I mentioned above, Snappers is a restaurant/bar located approximately 300 +/- feet from the Dove Creek Lodge (within walking distance). It appears they have entertainment on Friday and Saturday nights and, yes, you can hear it while at the hotel but by no way is it obnoxious nor does the music go into the wee hours. (Also, Snapper’s food was delightful albeit a little on the pricey side.)
reviews.title: Simply the Best this side of Key West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as the Dove Creek Lodge’s location, other than walking to Snapper’s, you will have to drive everywhere but if you are bringing a boat and plan on strictly boating all day/night, then this place is for you. You can not beat the instant ocean access!
reviews.title: Charming Inn....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on Key Largo with no reservation, planning to stay at another hotel where we had stayed several times but it was closed for remodeling. We decided to have lunch at Snappers Restaurant before looking for another place to spend the night. Arriving at Snappers we noticed the Dove Creek Lodge right next door. We went into the lobby and asked their rates and to see a room. The receptionest was very friendly and helpful and we decided on a one bedroom suite with ocean & pool view. The rooms were very neat, clean and attractively decorated. We had the complimentary continental breakfast which was in a lodge type setting with a great view.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful service!

description: Newly part of the Ascend Collection of Choice Hotels, Dove Creek Lodge is an intimate island style boutique hotel. Warm, friendly and uncomplicated. Inspired by the lore of Hemingway's Caribbean hideaways. Dove Creek Lodge is the perfect choice for your next island retreat. Located on the Atlantic Ocean, in Key Largo, Dove Creek lodge sits adjacent to John Pennekamp Coral Reef State Park. In the center of the best fishing, diving and family fun you will ever experience.Come, step through our doors and see what we're all about.
